Usage: Implies a negative or undesirable outcome. It is often used to blame someone or something for causing trouble or harm.
Sentence: 電車が遅れたせいで、会議に間に合わなかった。
Translation: I was late for the meeting because the train was delayed.
Sentence.1: 道にあった石のせいで、転んでけがをしてしまった。
Translation.1: A stone on the road caused him to fall and injure himself.
Sentence.2: 雨が降り続いたせいで、夏祭りが中止になった。
Translation.2: The summer festival was canceled due to the continuous rain.

Usage: Implies a positive or favorable outcome. It is often used to express gratitude or appreciation for someone or something that helped or benefited the speaker.
Sentence: 先生のおかげで、日本語が上達した。
Translation: Thanks to the teacher, I improved my Japanese.
Sentence.1: こうしてプロの選手になれたのも、指導してくれた父のおかげだ。
Translation.1: It is thanks to my father, who guided me, that I became a professional player in this way.
Sentence.2: みんなの応援のおかげで、苦しくても最後まで走ることができた。
Translation.2: Thanks to everyone's support, I was able to run to the end even though it was painful.

Usage: Used to give an objective or factual reason for something. It is often used to make an excuse or explanation for one’s own or someone else’s behavior or situation.
Sentence: 彼は忙しいものだから、電話に出られない。
Translation: He can’t answer the phone because he is busy.
Sentence.1: 宿題を忘れてしまったものだから、先生に怒られてしまった。
Translation.1: I forgot to do my homework, so the teacher got mad at me.
Sentence.2: 久しぶりの買い物だったもので、つい買い過ぎてしまいました。
Translation.2: It had been a long time since I had shopped, and I ended up buying too much.

Usage: Used to indicate the purpose or goal of an action, or the cause or result of a situation. It can be used for both positive and negative outcomes, depending on the context.
Sentence: 地震のために、電車が止まった。
Translation: The train stopped because of the earthquake.
Sentence.1: 体調が悪いため、今日は仕事を休みました。
Translation.1: I took the day off work today because I am not feeling well.
Sentence.2: 急に店を休みにしたのは、冷蔵庫の調子が悪いためだ。
Translation.2: The reason for the sudden closing of the restaurant was because of a bad refrigerator.

Usage: Used to emphasize or assert one’s reason for something. It is often used to make a request, a suggestion, or a complaint based on the reason.
Sentence: あなたが約束したのだから、守ってください。
Translation: Because you made a promise, please keep it.
Sentence.1: 最近ちゃんと眠れていないのですから、今日は早く寝てください。
Translation.1: You haven't been sleeping properly lately, so please go to bed early today.
Sentence.2: せっかくのパーティーなんですから、楽しんでいってくださいね。
Translation.2: It's a party, so please enjoy yourself.

Meaning: taking ~ as a start・as a result of
Usage: Used to indicate that something triggered or initiated a change or a new situation. It usually implies a positive or significant outcome. Focus on the time of change.
Sentence: 留学をきっかけに、彼女は英語がペラペラになった。
Translation: As a result of studying abroad, she became fluent in English.
Sentence.1: パソコンを買ったのをきっかけに、書類の作り方を覚えた。
Translation.1: I learned how to make documents when I bought a computer.
Sentence.2: しかしあるオーディションをきっかけに転機が訪れます。
Translation.2: However, a turning point came after an audition.

Meaning: as a result of・taking advantage of
Usage: Used to indicate that something triggered or initiated a change or a new situation. It can also imply a negative or accidental outcome. Focus more on the cause than the outcome.
Sentence: 事故がきっかけで、彼は記憶を失った。
Translation: He lost his memory as a result of the accident.
Sentence.1: 子どものころみに行った映画がきっかけで、音楽を学ぶようになった。
Translation.1: I began to study music because of a movie I went to see as a child.
Sentence.2: この研究がきっかけで酵素について学ぶこととなった。
Translation.2: This research led him to learn about enzymes.

Meaning: it means that・the reason is that
Usage: Used to draw a logical conclusion or explain a situation based on some evidence or grounds. It can also imply the speaker’s judgment or opinion.
Sentence: あなたは皆から選ばれたわけだ。頑張るのは当然だ。
Translation: You were chosen by everyone. The reason is that you have to work hard.
Sentence.1: 君の話をまとめると、つまり明日から一週間休みたいというわけだ。
Translation.1: To summarize your story, that means you want to take a week off starting tomorrow.
Sentence.2: 彼女は美容師だそうだ。だからかみの毛の色が素敵なわけだ。
Translation.2: She is a hairdresser. That's why her hair color is so nice.

Usage: Used to indicate that a certain state or situation has continued from a specific point in time until the present or another point in time.
Sentence: 彼は10年前に日本に来た以来、ずっとここに住んでいる。
Translation: He has been living here ever since he came to Japan 10 years ago.
Sentence.1: 初めて海外に行って以来、文化の違いに興味を持つようになった。
Translation.1: Since my first trip abroad, I have become interested in cultural differences.
Sentence.2: クリスマス以来、ずいぶん太ってしまった。
Translation.2: I have gained a lot of weight since Christmas.

Usage: Used to indicate the agent, method, or factor of an action or a situation. It can also express variation or difference depending on the condition or circumstance.
Sentence: 病気の流行によって、生活や仕事の仕方が大きく変わった。
Translation: The disease epidemic has changed the way we live and work.
Sentence.1: この本と出会ったことによって、本を読む楽しさがわかった。
Translation.1: I discovered the joy of reading books when I came across this book.
Sentence.2: 大雪により、いくつかの道が通れなくなっている。
Translation.2: Heavy snowfall has rendered some roads impassable.

Usage: Used to express the purpose or reason of an action or the result or consequence of a situation.
Sentence: 体調が悪いため、今日は仕事を休みました。
Translation: I took the day off work today because I am not feeling well.
Sentence.1: 同期のため、テキストとデータベースを検索中。
Translation.1: Searching text and database for synchronization.
Sentence.2: ファイルのロケーションのため、現在制限されています。
Translation.2: Currently restricted due to file location.

Meaning: for・in order to・for the benefit of・because of・as a result of
Usage: Used to indicate the purpose, goal or benefit of an action or thing. To indicate the cause or reason of a situation or phenomenon.
Sentence: 日本へ旅行をするために、貯金しています。
Translation: I’m saving money in order to travel to Japan.
Sentence.1: 健康のために、毎朝に走っています。
Translation.1: I go running every morning for my health.
Sentence.2: このスーツは面接のために買いました。
Translation.2: I bought this suit for the interview.

Meaning: for・for the sake of・for the purpose of
Usage: Indicates that the modified noun is intended or needed for the sake of the modifier.
Sentence: これは私の誕生日のためのケーキです。
Translation: This is a cake for my birthday.
Sentence.1: これは彼女の幸せのためのプレゼントです。
Translation.1: This is a present for the sake of her happiness.
Sentence.2: これは英語の勉強のためのアプリです。
Translation.2: This is an app for the purpose of studying English.

Meaning: as it is・current state・without changing
Usage: Can be used to express something that remains in the same condition or situation or to express a lack of change or intervention.
Sentence: 私のふるさとの景色は子どものころのまま変わっていない。
Translation: The landscape of my hometown has not changed since I was a child.
Sentence.1: エアコンをつけたまま、家を出てしまった。I
Translation.1: I left the house with the air conditioner on.
Sentence.2: 彼は自分の気持ちのままに行動する。
Translation.2: He acts according to his feelings.

Usage: Expresses that two actions or states are happening simultaneously or continuously.
Sentence: 諸事情を考慮しつつ計画を立てる。
Translation: To make a plan while considering various circumstances.
Sentence.1: 大声で叫びつつ走りだす。
Translation.1: To run away while screaming loudly.
Sentence.2: アイスクリームを食べつつ、歩いた。
Translation.2: I walked while eating ice cream.

Meaning: together with・at the same time・as well as
Usage: Indicate that two actions or states happen simultaneously or immediately after each other. Indicate that something changes or develops in accordance with or following something else.
Sentence: 気温が上がるとともに、体調が悪くなる人が増えてきた。
Translation: As the temperature rises, more and more people are getting sick.
Sentence.1: 高校卒業とともに、引っ越しをして東京で仕事を始めた。
Translation.1: Upon graduation from high school, he moved and began working in Tokyo.
Sentence.2: 世界はスマートフォンの普及とともに、大きく変化した。
Translation.2: The world has changed dramatically with the spread of smartphones.

Usage: Used to emphasize the continuation or the direction of the action or change. Describe a gradual change.
Sentence: 季節は秋に変わりつつある
Translation: The season is changing to autumn.
Sentence.1: 空は晴れあがりつつあった。
Translation.1: The sky was clearing up.
Sentence.2: 時代の変化に合わせて、人々の働き方は変わりつつある。
Translation.2: The way people work is changing with the changing times.

Usage: Express that the degree of something changes in proportion to the degree of another thing. Often used to show a causal relationship between two things.
Sentence: 料理は作れば作るほど上手になるものだ。
Translation: The more you cook, the better you get at it.
Sentence.1: マンゴーやバナナは甘ければ甘いほどいい。
Translation.1: The sweeter the mango or banana, the better.
Sentence.2: ゲームは相手が強ければ強いほど面白いです。
Translation.2: The stronger the opponent is, the more interesting the game is.

Meaning: as・in accordance with・in proportion to
Usage: Express that something changes or happens in accordance with or in proportion to something else. used to show a causal or proportional relationship between two things.
Sentence: 春が近づくにしたがって、桜の花が咲き始める。
Translation: As spring approaches, cherry blossoms begin to bloom.
Sentence.1: 寒くなるにしたがって、風邪を引く人も増えてくる。
Translation.1: As the weather gets colder, more people catch colds.
Sentence.2: 会社が成長するにしたがって、社員の数も増えてきた。
Translation.2: As the company grows, the number of employees also increases.

Usage: Emphasize the quantity, quality, continuation, direction or recency of something.
Sentence: 給料は上がらないのに、物価は高くなるばかりだ。
Translation: Salaries are not going up, but prices are only getting higher.
Sentence.1: かぜをひいてしまい、体調が悪くなるばかりだ。
Translation.1: I've caught a cold and I'm just getting sicker and sicker.
Sentence.2: 毎日の残業で疲れがたまるばかりだ。
Translation.2: Working overtime every day just makes me tired.

Meaning: as・in the role of・in the capacity of
Usage: Indicate the role, status, qualification or function of something or someone.
Sentence: コンビニの店長として、仕事は全部できるようになるべきだ。
Translation: As a convenience store manager, you should be able to do all the work.
Sentence.1: 入学式では、新入生の代表としてみんなの前で話をした。
Translation.1: At the entrance ceremony, I spoke in front of everyone as a representative of the new students.
Sentence.2: もう少し、大人としての行動を考え直しましょう。
Translation.2: Let's rethink our behavior as adults a little more.

Usage: Express the perspective, opinion or benefit of someone or something. Point of view or the standard of judgment for the following statement.
Sentence: 私にとっての幸せとは、家族と一緒に過ごすことだ。
Translation: Happiness for me is spending time with my family.
Sentence.1: この問題は私にとって 難しすぎる。
Translation.1: This problem is too difficult for me.
Sentence.2: どんな人にとっても生活しやすい国にすることを目標にしている。
Translation.2: The goal is to make the country an easy place to live for all people.

Usage: Indicate the source, evidence or reason for something.
Sentence: 年の始めに決めた目標に基づいて、計画を立てる。
Translation: Make a plan based on the goals you set at the beginning of the year.
Sentence.1: この映画は、実際にあった出来事に基づいて作られました。
Translation.1: The film was based on actual events.
Sentence.2: この商品は、多くの人の意見に基づいて作られている。
Translation.2: This product is based on the opinions of many people.

Usage: Indicate the main point, area or target of something.
Sentence: 若者を中心にして、古いカメラで写真を撮ることが流行っている。
Translation: Taking pictures with old cameras is becoming popular, especially among young people.
Sentence.1: この本は日本文化を中心に紹介している。
Translation.1: The book focuses on Japanese culture.
Sentence.2: 今夜は、西日本を中心に大雨になると予報されている。
Translation.2: Tonight, heavy rains are forecast mainly over western Japan.

Usage: Indicate the similarity, conformity or accordance of something with something else.
Sentence: 先生の言ったとおり、試験は難しかった。
Translation: As the teacher said, the exam was difficult.
Sentence.1: 地図のとおりに歩いてください。
Translation.1: Please walk according to the map.
Sentence.2: 本に書いてあるとおりにやったのに、うまくいかない。
Translation.2: I did everything by the book, but it didn't work.

Usage: Indicate the name, content, quotation or opinion of something or someone. Used to explain or tell me something unknown to me.
Sentence: これは「寿司」という 日本の食べ物です。
Translation: This is a Japanese food called sushi.
Sentence.1: いわゆる鑑賞というレベルじゃない。
Translation.1: This is not the level of so-called appreciation.
Sentence.2: しかしまだブロック伝送という大きな問題があります。
Translation.2: But there is still the big problem of block transmission.

Usage: Indicate the direction, opposition or action towards something or someone.
Sentence: 彼女は彼に対して優しい態度をとった。
Translation: She took a kindly attitude toward him.
Sentence.1: 政府に対して抗議の声が上がった。
Translation.1: There were protests against the government.
Sentence.2: あなたの仕事に対する考え方を教えてください。
Translation.2: What is your approach to your work?

Usage: Indicate the topic or content of something.
Sentence: あなたの趣味について教えてください。
Translation: Tell us about your hobbies.
Sentence.1: この本は日本の歴史について書かれている。
Translation.1: This book is about the history of Japan.
Sentence.2: 野球の試合について話し合っている。
Translation.2: They discuss baseball games.

Usage: Indicate the topic or scope of something.
Sentence: 植物に関して、父はかなり詳しい。
Translation: My father knows quite a bit about plants.
Sentence.1: その場にいた人から、事件に関しての話を聞き出した。
Translation.1: We got stories from people who were there about the incident.
Sentence.2: 環境問題に関して議論する必要がある。
Translation.2: Need to discuss on environmental issues.

Usage: Emphatic particle corresponding to precisely when used to underline and differentiate a point.
Sentence: これこそ私が欲しかった本です。
Translation: This is the very book I wanted.
Sentence.1: この資料こそ長い間探していたものだ。
Translation.1: This material is what I have been looking for for a long time.
Sentence.2: 今こそ行動しなければならない。
Translation.2: Now is the time to act.

Meaning: even・even if it is only・how about・or something
Usage: Used to imply os show by extreme example that something is obvious. Used in proposals, expressions of intent, request, suggestions or an offer.
Sentence: お茶でも飲みましょうか。
Translation: Shall we have a cup of tea?
Sentence.1: こんなことは子供でも知っている。
Translation.1: Even children know these things.
Sentence.2: 外でも勉強できますよ。
Translation.2: You can also study outside.

Usage: Used with extreme examples that underline unexpected degree.
Sentence: 学者でさえ解けない問題が試験に出た。
Translation: Problems that even scholars could not solve were on the exam.
Sentence.1: 中学校さえ行かなかったのです。
Translation.1: He did not even go to middle school.
Sentence.2: 彼は日本語 さえ 話せないのに、日本に住みたいと言っている。
Translation.2: He can’t even speak Japanese, but he says he wants to live in Japan.

Usage: Used with extreme examples. Emphatic negative particle.
Sentence: 一日も休まないで学校に通った。
Translation: I went to school without missing a single day.
Sentence.1: 都市の農場経営は商業的にさえも実行可能です。
Translation.1: Urban farm management is even commercially viable.
Sentence.2: どちらも何も残らなかった。
Translation.2: Neither of them were left with anything.

Meaning: or something like that or etc
Usage: Used to suggest something or raise alternatives. Used to introduce examples or to indicate that other similar items are not listed.
Sentence: この服などいかがですか。似合いますよ。
Translation: How about this dress? It will look good on you.
Sentence.1: 私は野菜などを買いにスーパーに行きました。
Translation.1: I went to the supermarket to buy vegetables and other things.
Sentence.2: データ暗号化などのセキュリティ機能を搭載する。
Translation.2: Security features such as data encryption will be provided.
